meanings.definition: A person who drives a horse-drawn carriage for hire.
meanings.sent1: The jarveys in the city are always busy taking people around.
meanings.sent2: We hired a couple of jarveys to take us on a tour of the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The jarveys decided to have a race with their carriages, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The jarveys were like modern-day charioteers, skillfully maneuvering their carriages through the bustling streets.
meanings.sent5: The image of the jarveys in their traditional attire will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.sent1: We saw a group of jarveys waiting for passengers near the train station.
meanings.sent2: The jarveys greeted us warmly as we approached them for a ride.
meanings.sent3: The jarveys looked like a team of professionals ready to conquer the roads.
meanings.sent4: The jarveys stood out in their distinctive uniforms, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the jarveys' carriage wheels rolling on the cobblestone road echoed through the town.
